[1] Calculated environmental benefits stated in this diagram are based on estimates from: our independent life cycle analyses (LCA), applied to volumes of the products and regions covered by these LCAs only; andinternal data collection (for multimodal/collaborative transport programs and carbon neutral products).\nThese represent a conservative estimate of the global environmental benefits of our pooled products for the Year. Further information is provided in our\nsupplementary information document, available on our website.
[2] 2019 LCA savings were re-calculated and restated. The restatement was performed in 2020 to remediate an issue with LCA allocation.
[3] FY20 data was restated due to a more recent LCA study undertaken in the US

[4] FY20 Note: Due to the pandemic of COVID-19, many markets opted for not launching the Relationship Survey in the last quarter of FY20 (FY20_Q4). Only NA and Australia - Pallet and Pallecon invited customers to participate in the survey in May-June 2020.

[5] In FY22 the methodology changed from quarterly 2-year cycle to six-monthly annual cycle and from 80% revenue to 100% sampling of contacts in Salesforce. This resulted in responses in FY22 being more than double the responses in FY21.
[6] Totals not equaling 100 due to some employees' gender being undeclared
[7] Included Containers Aerospace, Oil & Gas and LeanLogistics Prior to their divestment
[8] Age categories updated in alignment with our internal system for ease of reporting

[9] Prior to FY21, this dataset was reported as days rather than hours. The reason for the change is the Workday system has better capability to report in hours, this gives a clearer less error prone process
[10] Data reported excludes any offline training, figures reported are directly from Brambles Learning Management System (LMS)
[11] FY23 Note: As of Sept 2022 there was a change of survey methodology to a waveless format, surveying 100% of customers in an annual basis
